definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: So with sarcophagi and just like, different stones from the pyramids and statues.
sentences.chinese: 有石棺，還有金字塔和雕像上的各種石頭。

sentences.english: Shi Han is inters the Buddha Buddhist relics the most outer layer sarcophagus.
sentences.chinese: 石函是安葬佛陀舍利的最外層石棺。

sentences.english: There are now stricter relationship requirements for Woohooing with Sims in the Sarcophagus .
sentences.chinese: 在石棺裏嘿咻現在需要的關係條件更加嚴格。

sentences.english: Hundreds of tons of radioactive material remain inside, guides say.
sentences.chinese: 導遊稱，石棺內仍有數百噸計的輻射物質。

sentences.english: You go to church to search for various shrines and open sarcophaguses.
sentences.chinese: 你去教堂尋找各種祭壇並且打開石棺。

sentences.english: 4 today is still covered by the concrete cover called the 'sarcophagus' which was hastily improvised to stem the outflow of radiation.
sentences.chinese: 石棺是在搶險時倉促建成，用以遏制輻射外泄。

sentences.english: Walk into the light coming out of the sarcophagus to meet King Arthur.
sentences.chinese: 走進走出石棺，以滿足亞瑟王光。
其中一具石棺仍然密封着。

sentences.english: Red granite was commonly used in Thebes for the sarcophagi of high officials.
sentences.chinese: 紅色花崗岩是常用的官員在底比斯爲石棺高。

definition: underground palace (as part of imperial tomb)
path leading to a grave/tomb passage/aisle leading to the coffin chamber of an ancient tomb
rock cave/grotto/cliff caves (often with Buddhist statues)
